instructions.instruction: Stack the white object on the baking tray.
What is the weight of the soda can?
Place the blue object on the left part of the table.
Stack the glass object on the bowl on the plate.
Pick up the heaviest of all ceramic objects.
Measure the weight of ceramic objects.
Remove ceramic objects from the right part of the table.
Move the lightest of ceramic objects to the right part of the table.
Move the glass to the left part of the table.
What is the weight of the brown object?
Stack the heaviest of all ceramic objects on top of the bowl.
Stack the brown object on the purple object.
Place the glass on the bowl on top of the purple object.
Pick up the heaviest of all glass objects.
Measure the weight of all ceramic objects.
Measure the weight of the glass.
Remove all transparent objects from the left part of the table.
Move the heaviest of glass objects to the right part of the table.
Place the white object on the left part of the table.
Stack all transparent objects from heaviest to lightest.
Place the lightest of transparent objects on top of the plastic object.
Stack the glass on the glass bowl on top of the yellow object.
Stack the glass on top of the glass bowl.
Pick up the lightest of all bowls.
Measure the weight of all bowls.
What is the weight of the transparent object?
Move the lightest of bowls to the left part of the table.
Place the white object on the right part of the table.
Stack all bowls from heaviest to lightest.
Stack the heaviest of bowls on the transparent object.
Place the glass object on the white object.
Place the white object on top of the green object on the food box.
Pick up the lightest of all brown objects.
Measure the weight of ceramic objects.
Measure the weight of the bowl.
Move the lightest of ceramic objects to the left part of the table.
Move the bowl to the right part of the table.
Stack brown objects from heaviest to lightest.
Place the heaviest of all ceramic objects on top of the chopping board.
Stack the mug on top of the bowl.
Stack the mug on the bowl on top of the rubber object.
Pick up the heaviest of all plastic objects.
What is the weight of metal objects?
Measure the weight of the brown object.
Remove metal objects from the right part of the table.
Move the lightest of all plastic objects to the left part of the table.
Move the transparent object to the left part of the table.
Stack plastic objects from heaviest to lightest.
Stack the heaviest of plastic objects on top of the bowl.
Place the yellow object on the brown object.
Measure the weight of the wine glass.
Move the mug to the left part of the table.
Place the ceramic object on the brown object.
Pick up the lightest of mugs.
Measure the weight of all mugs.
What is the weight of the plastic object?
Remove mugs from the right part of the table.
Place the lightest of mugs on the left part of the table.
Move the red object to the right part of the table.
Stack the red object on top of the plastic object on the purple object.
Stack the lightest of all mugs on the plate.
Place the black object on the green object.
Pick up the lightest of all bowls.
What is the weight of ceramic objects?
Measure the weight of the black object.
Clean the left part of the table from ceramic objects.
Move the lightest of bowls to the left part of the table.
Move the mug to the right part of the table.
Stack all ceramic objects from heaviest to lightest.
Stack the lightest of bowls on the plastic object.
Place the white object on the brown object on top of the green object.
Stack the white object on the brown object.
Pick up the lightest of all red objects.
What is the weight of all red objects?
Measure the weight of the green object.
Clean the left part of the table from bowls.
Place the lightest of red objects on the right part of the table.
Place the green object on the left part of the table.
Stack bowls from heaviest to lightest.
Stack the lightest of all bowls on the yellow object.
Place the red soda can on top of the food box.
